programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: (1998) Michael Bay's star-studded disaster movie starring Bruce Willis. The world's greatest drillers are sent into space to nuke a huge asteroid that's hurtling towards Earth.

programme.title: P'tang, Yang, Kipperbang
programme.desc: (1982) John Albasiny stars in Michael Apted's comedy as a girl-obsessed 14-year-old who wants England to win the Ashes almost as much as he wants to kiss classmate Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: (1955) Cold War-influenced western starring Glenn Ford and Edward G Robinson. A smallholder stands alone against the expansionist plans and brutal tactics of a tyrannical rancher.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Three Billboards Outside...
programme.desc: ...Ebbing, Missouri: (2017) Oscar-winning dark comedy about a mother who wants the cops to solve her daughter's murder using three precisely worded billboards. Starring Frances McDormand.

programme.title: Naked
programme.desc: (1994) Mike Leigh's dark drama stars David Thewlis as an out-of-work Mancunian whose trip to London to visit his ex-girlfriend degenerates into a misogynistic, misanthropic rant.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: (2013) Drama starring Tom Hardy. A construction manager's life dramatically begins to fall apart as he drives home from work. With the voices of Ruth Wilson, Olivia Colman and Andrew Scott.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: (1959) Satirical comedy starring Peter Sellers (in a triple role) and the original Doctor Who, William Hartnell. The world's smallest state, Grand Fenwick, declares war on the USA.

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: (1976) Touching romance starring Sean Connery and Audrey Hepburn. The ageing legend Robin Hood returns to Sherwood Forest and discovers that, while he was away, Marian has become an Abbess.

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
programme.desc: (2018) Oscar-winning animated superhero adventure with the voices of Shameik Moore, Kathryn Hahn and Nicolas Cage. Can a gang of Spider-heroes save the universe from reality-bending chaos?

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: (2004) Drama. Dennis Quaid stars as the captain of an aircraft downed in the desert. There's no hope of rescue, unless he and the survivors can build another plane from the wreckage.

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: (2013) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker. A small-town sheriff and his inexperienced staff take on a drug cartel boss who's fleeing to Mexico.

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: (2008) Comedy-drama. Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson star as Irish hitmen who are banished to Belgium by their boss after they botch a job. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: (2018) World War II horror produced by JJ Abrams, with Jovan Adepo. A unit of American soldiers parachute into occupied France to be confronted by the horrific results of Nazi experiments.

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: After surviving an attempt on her life, TikTok star Sania Khan went viral campaigning for South Asian women's rights. Little did she realise this would put her in mortal danger from her ex-husband.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer, actress and presenter Toyah Willcox. It's time to spruce up the guinea pig enclosure at the wildlife park and test out some TikTok cooking hacks back in the kitchen, while local upcycler Sarah joins the trio to show everyone how to glam up their lampshades

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is joined by fellow boyband superstar Ronan Keating in an exploration of Australia's red centre. Starting in Alice Springs, Gary and Ronan visit a local brewery to help out behind the scenes before learning to cook an Australian bush staple over a fire, get lessons in astronomy and the didgeridoo, and visit the sacred site of Uluru

programme.title: Riddiculous for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Ranvir Singh hosts a charity edition, with former England goalkeeper David James, TV and radio presenter Rickie Haywood-Williams and comedian Maisie Adam joining previous champions Ilana, Jessica and Maxine to take on the Riddlemaster to raise money for Unicef

programme.title: Tipping Point for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts a special edition in aid of Soccer Aid for Unicef. How will Freestyle Football World Champion, Liv Cooke, A Place in the Sun presenter Lee Juggurnauth, and ITV favourite Jeff Brazier do as they take on the machine in the hope of winning 10,000 to support children around the world?

programme.title: The Chase for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a charity edition of the quiz for Soccer Aid as Dermot O'Leary, Lynsey Hipgrave, Kyle Walker and Alex Brooker pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe is quick to accuse Billy, Clemmie's phone is missing, and Cain and Tracy try to put the blame on each other

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lou incenses Maria by turning up at the Platts' barbecue uninvited, Betsy secretly pays a visit to someone in prison, and Sally arrives home to find Tim minding Joanie and Shanice

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. The nationwide challenge sees him take on five back-to-back endurance days, running a total of five marathons and cycling over 130 miles. Stopping at iconic football grounds, Sam gets a boost from famous faces as he battles blisters, exhaustion and the elements for charity

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? For Soccer Aid
programme.desc: The studio audience is back for a special edition of the quiz. Host Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions as comedians Eddie Izzard and Omid Djalili search for the right answers as they try to win a million pounds for Unicef

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Nina Wadia, DJ Target, Josh Jones and Eddie Nestor join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Stephen K Amos to take viewers on a tour of Black British history.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Joe Wicks to try South African dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the show's first male guest of honour, and Aldo Zilli dishes up a delicious brunch

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team make over a family garden in south Wales, for the benefit of father-of-three Chris Garlick, who lost his hands and feet to sepsis just 22 months earlier. Katie Rushworth creates a contemporary water-feature-cum-bench that would look good in any garden and Frances Tophill shows how soft naturalistic planting with the emphasis on scent can create the perfect garden for wellness

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by comedian and Gogglebox star Babatude Aleshe for a tasty Caribbean breakfast of salt cod bujol. Jimmy presents a new toy to the polar bears at the wildlife park and local crafter Bridget teaches the art of felting to Jimmy, Shivi and Bubatunde

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is joined by former BBC Breakfast host Louise Minchin, chefs Levi Roots and Atul Kochhar, and forager Alysia Vasey who is celebrating some fantastic British fruit.

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by TV presenter Chris Bavin, starting in the city's outskirts by diving into the world of regenerative farming, before doing a spot of line fishing. The real catch of the day, however, might be a tour of Hong Kong's last traditional roasting pits for Chris

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef visits Hampton Court Palace, finding out about its Great Vine and the walled garden's impressive collection of herbs. Raymond heads to the historical kitchens to meet members of the re-enactment team, who show him how hot chocolate would have been made in Georgian times

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which couple Michelle and Callum from Aberdeen, friends Chris and Mark from Gateshead, and neighbours Lindsay and Jordan from Shropshire use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they won earlier or leave with nothing

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Rugby Final
programme.desc: Bath Rugby v Leicester Tigers (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the final from Allianz Stadium Twickenham. Northampton Saints were the victorious team last year, defeating Bath 25-21, but there will be a new champion crowned this time around as the Saints failed to reach the semi-finals. Leicester edged out Sale Sharks in the semi-final thanks to a 21-16 victory, while Bath made it to this stage thanks to a 34-20 win over Bristol Bears

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts an I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here special as former participants AJ Pritchard, Hollie Arnold, Giovanna Fletcher and Russell Watson pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Godzilla vs Kong
programme.desc: Monster adventure starring Alexander Skarsgard, Millie Bobby Brown and Rebecca Hall. A team of scientists is recruited by a mysterious corporation to search for a power source in the "Hollow Earth", using Kong as their guide. But Godzilla sees Kong as a rival to his dominance of the surface world, and there can only be one alpha.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Steph McGovern and Dion Dublin answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie arrives at Tovey and Anton's wedding alone, where she covers for Joe and continues to lie - even when presented with evidence. Edged closer to the singles table, Birdie goes through the motions of speeches, before lashing out at Margeaux

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie pulls herself together and starts investigating Joe, talking to his ex-business partners, brothers and the infamous Tessa Rain who all have their own stories of him. When Allan appears at her office she realises that she was simply a pawn in a much larger scam

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon 2
programme.desc: Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler and Cate Blanchett. After five years during which time the Vikings and dragons have learned to live together, Hiccup discovers there's a threat to that peaceful status quo that needs to be faced.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by the Rev Richard Coles to try falconry, while hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform Liza Raby, who has raised more than 170,000 for charity. Manisha Morgan is on hand to make some tasty treats

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by author and screenwriter Anthony Horowitz, Dragons' Den star Deborah Meaden and broadcaster and The One Show host Alex Jones. David Domoney has tips to brighten up patios in time for summer, drinks expert Becky Paskin is in charge of refreshments with tea-infused tipples, Lesley Joseph introduces us to the shy blue shark, we get a look at some new arrivals as the lambing season comes to an end

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan showcases the latest colour and seasonal highlights from his plot, Giovanna Fletcher invites viewers into her own patch for the first time, and Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a beautifully designed Italian-inspired space

programme.title: The Royal Procession at Ascot: Celebrating 200 Years
programme.desc: Alice Loxton celebrates the history and heritage of the opening to the Royal Ascot meeting, exploring why it remains so popular and important to this day. The programme also hears from those who have experienced being in the procession first-hand and showcase some never-before-seen footage of key moments

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Can Stefan from Huddersfield, Janet from Bridgwater, Alex from Manchester and Caron from London work together as a team and take down one of the country's finest quiz brains? Bradley Walsh hosts as they try to beat the Chaser for thousands of pounds

programme.title: Diamonds Are Forever
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery. When it is discovered that large amounts of diamonds are being smuggled out of South Africa, James Bond is sent to investigate and comes up against an old enemy.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: Soccer Aid for Unicef 2025
programme.desc: England v Soccer Aid World XI (Kick-off 7.30pm). Dermot O'Leary and Alex Scott host the pre-match build-up before presenting live coverage of the charity match from Old Trafford, the home of Manchester United. This year's star-studded line-up includes Tyson Fury, Wayne Rooney, Gary Neville, Vicki McClure, Mo Farah, Harry Redknapp, Tom Grennan, Denise Lewis, Jill Scott, Nadia Nadim and many more famous faces playing in aid of Unicef

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: America's Veterans - The War Within
programme.desc: Deeyah Khan's film explores the devastating psychological aftermath of serving in the military in wartime. Travelling from Alabama to Washington, she speaks to veterans of America's War on Terror about their combat experiences, including accounts of violence unleashed on civilians in Iraq and Afghanistan. Part of the Exposure strand, the film explores the dehumanising effects of war and its long-term social impact on America and beyond

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at more of the most memorable moments from recent series, including interviews with Madonna, Lee Evans, Jennifer Hudson, Perrie Edwards, Liam Gallagher, Richard Gere, Lily Allen, Frank Skinner and Johannes Radebe

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: After surviving an attempt on her life, TikTok star Sania Khan went viral campaigning for South Asian women's rights. Little did she realise this would put her in mortal danger from her ex-husband.

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe is quick to accuse Billy, Clemmie's phone is missing, and Cain and Tracy try to put the blame on each other

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lou incenses Maria by turning up at the Platts' barbecue uninvited, Betsy secretly pays a visit to someone in prison, and Sally arrives home to find Tim minding Joanie and Shanice

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. The nationwide challenge sees him take on five back-to-back endurance days, running a total of five marathons and cycling over 130 miles. Stopping at iconic football grounds, Sam gets a boost from famous faces as he battles blisters, exhaustion and the elements for charity

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? For Soccer Aid
programme.desc: The studio audience is back for a special edition of the quiz. Host Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions as comedians Eddie Izzard and Omid Djalili search for the right answers as they try to win a million pounds for Unicef

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Nina Wadia, DJ Target, Josh Jones and Eddie Nestor join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Stephen K Amos to take viewers on a tour of Black British history.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Joe Wicks to try South African dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the show's first male guest of honour, and Aldo Zilli dishes up a delicious brunch

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team make over a family garden in south Wales, for the benefit of father-of-three Chris Garlick, who lost his hands and feet to sepsis just 22 months earlier. Katie Rushworth creates a contemporary water-feature-cum-bench that would look good in any garden and Frances Tophill shows how soft naturalistic planting with the emphasis on scent can create the perfect garden for wellness

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by comedian and Gogglebox star Babatude Aleshe for a tasty Caribbean breakfast of salt cod bujol. Jimmy presents a new toy to the polar bears at the wildlife park and local crafter Bridget teaches the art of felting to Jimmy, Shivi and Bubatunde

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is joined by former BBC Breakfast host Louise Minchin, chefs Levi Roots and Atul Kochhar, and forager Alysia Vasey who is celebrating some fantastic British fruit.

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by TV presenter Chris Bavin, starting in the city's outskirts by diving into the world of regenerative farming, before doing a spot of line fishing. The real catch of the day, however, might be a tour of Hong Kong's last traditional roasting pits for Chris

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef visits Hampton Court Palace, finding out about its Great Vine and the walled garden's impressive collection of herbs. Raymond heads to the historical kitchens to meet members of the re-enactment team, who show him how hot chocolate would have been made in Georgian times

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which couple Michelle and Callum from Aberdeen, friends Chris and Mark from Gateshead, and neighbours Lindsay and Jordan from Shropshire use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they won earlier or leave with nothing

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Rugby Final
programme.desc: Bath Rugby v Leicester Tigers (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the final from Allianz Stadium Twickenham. Northampton Saints were the victorious team last year, defeating Bath 25-21, but there will be a new champion crowned this time around as the Saints failed to reach the semi-finals. Leicester edged out Sale Sharks in the semi-final thanks to a 21-16 victory, while Bath made it to this stage thanks to a 34-20 win over Bristol Bears

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts an I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here special as former participants AJ Pritchard, Hollie Arnold, Giovanna Fletcher and Russell Watson pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Godzilla vs Kong
programme.desc: Monster adventure starring Alexander Skarsgard, Millie Bobby Brown and Rebecca Hall. A team of scientists is recruited by a mysterious corporation to search for a power source in the "Hollow Earth", using Kong as their guide. But Godzilla sees Kong as a rival to his dominance of the surface world, and there can only be one alpha.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Steph McGovern and Dion Dublin answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie arrives at Tovey and Anton's wedding alone, where she covers for Joe and continues to lie - even when presented with evidence. Edged closer to the singles table, Birdie goes through the motions of speeches, before lashing out at Margeaux

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie pulls herself together and starts investigating Joe, talking to his ex-business partners, brothers and the infamous Tessa Rain who all have their own stories of him. When Allan appears at her office she realises that she was simply a pawn in a much larger scam

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens

programme.title: Gallagher Premiership Rugby Final
programme.desc: Bath Rugby v Leicester Tigers (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the final from Allianz Stadium Twickenham. Northampton Saints were the victorious team last year, defeating Bath 25-21, but there will be a new champion crowned this time around as the Saints failed to reach the semi-finals. Leicester edged out Sale Sharks in the semi-final thanks to a 21-16 victory, while Bath made it to this stage thanks to a 34-20 win over Bristol Bears
